website_summaries.verdict: Four times stronger than leather, these gloves also deliver the anti-bacterial protection you need when handling food.
pros: Superior grip with a snug fit
Provide the level of feeling you need to get the job done
Choice of small through extra large
Great for cleaning fish, mandolin slicers, and knives
cons: Not recommended for large machine operation
They do not prevent direct-point punctures

customer_reviews.title: Cannot trust the material!
customer_reviews.text: So let me get this straight.... these are supposed to protect your fingers from being sliced by a knife?? Just received mine in the mail and they came like this. Half inch whole in the ring finger slot. All I can say is wow. Maybe you want rethink trusting these gloves all together to do the job they are supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My new fish cleaning gloves.
customer_reviews.text: They fit like a glove! The fit was perfect for me. I know that's luck but yay me. I was very surprised at how thin and usable they were. I use them for cleaning fish and they help with gripping the slippery fish and bonus, I didn't get nailed by any spines or cut bones! I haven't tried cutting my finger off yet so I cannot attest to their armor ability. They are a soft burlap texture and very absorbent. The instructions say to hand wash them. They do take a bit to clean and my gloves will forever smell like fish.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron K. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Failed on first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after carelessly slicing my thumb on a mandolin. Used it one time with the mandolin and the tip of one of the fingers tore open. Fortunately, it didn't tear me, but I am disappointed in the lack of resistance to cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: NO MORE GETTING CUT
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great. I use my mandoline all the time and these gloves have been absolutely fantastic. They fit fine and I've had no problem controlling anything I slice. As for cleanup, I simply leave the gloves on while I rinse or wash my mandoline, when the gloves are wet I put dish soap on the gloves where they are dirty and wash my hands. Hang up the gloves to dry with the mandoline and put them away later. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Combes

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are super flexible & easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended to me by a friend who wears them in his wood working shop. So they are suitable to wear whenever you are using sharp objects. It is important to make sure you have the right size. The Seller has a handy guide that you should use so that you have the gloves fit properly. I just used them for the first time, so I can't as of yet speak to the durability of the item. They are very comfortable to wear & I felt like I had as much dexterity as I do barehanded. Only now I feel protected. I will definitely be buying these as gifts for my friends that are cooks.
customer_reviews.author: hecklerpix

customer_reviews.title: Flexible, good fit.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit really well and are very flexible. The finger tips are not bulky so you have a suprising amount of dexterity. I wear these when I use my box grater and my mandoline. They are a must for the mandoline (which is one of my all time favorite kitchen gadgets, but still scares the crap out of me when I use it). They did get a little stained when I was grating carrots, but washed up well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: I can use my mandoline again!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are perfect for protecting my hands and fingers when using my (extremely sharp!) mandoline. I can julienne a zucchini right down to the end without fear of cutting myself. I'm able to grip the vegetables firmly with no slippage. The gloves rinse clean in water (or add a drop of dish soap if you are really concerned and dry quickly. Well worth the price. I wish I had bought these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: KarenWho

customer_reviews.title: Not mandolin slicer resistant.
customer_reviews.text: Bad news: No match for a mandolin slicer. Good news: Saved a trip to the ER, bandages and stitches. In all fairness, these gloves are not advertised as chainmail. So you need to use the same level of care as if you weren't wearing them. I am giving 3 stars for the Save!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt S

customer_reviews.title: Finger savers!
customer_reviews.text: Great for saving fingers as an architecture student. I use really sharp blades for making models and I've slice open my fingers more times than I'd like to admit. These gloves have eliminated any new incidents. Recently I got a hamster and he is a bit of a biter. I had been scared to pick him up out of his cage, but I used these gloves to pick him up and now I've been able to bond with him and help him stop biting so much. He was unable to bite through the gloves despite his best effort. A+ product!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Real slippery! Get coated
customer_reviews.text: I gave these a low rating because at least for me these were sooo slippery! I know they are not the coated ones but I expected some grip. I used them for fishing and everything was slipping as soon as I put them on. So if grip is an issue, get the coated ones. Plus when I had to hand line a fish up I still managed to get cut even though it didn’t cut the glove. So get leather if you using for anything similar to me.
customer_reviews.author: hereyago5050

customer_reviews.title: Nice, helpful product
customer_reviews.text: I was worried these wouldnt fit since I have long fingers and wide hands (I can't wear women's gloves; i wear men's gloves). They fit beautifully. Snug (not tight), no excess fingertip material. I always wear these when using knives because i am on a blood thinner and don't want to take the chance cutting myself. It feels terrific to cook by myself again (instead if having my roommates chop/slice food). Since I haven't scraped or cut myself, I assume these are working. I'm still very careful around knives, but having this added protection eases my mind a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the small because I have long fingers and they fit very well. There is a tiny bit of stretch so they are forgiving about size. It is important to do the measuring as specified so you get the correct size. I like the fact that they are thin enough to actually feel what you're working with and to grip a knife safely and securely. There are no washing instructions packaged with the product, but the Youphoria people sent an email with directions, which was very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: jenjan

customer_reviews.title: fit and comfort
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are pretty darned good for wood carving. I'm a newby at hand carving and probably would have sliced a few new sections off my thumb or fingers as I've learned how to wield a knife on a material that is never the same in any single shave. I've experience the blade slide down the side of my finger twice now and am thankful for the integrity of this glove.
customer_reviews.author: B Gonzo

customer_reviews.title: Stains easily but pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because I am very nervous to cut food because I’m always paranoid I will cut myself. I tested multiple household knifes on these gloves before I wore them just to make sure and it worked fine! If you use a rigged knife it can get “caught” but did not cause a tear. To clean them I use dish soap and hand wash them. However, they take a long time to dry completely(like a whole day or little less), and they stain very easily. I was using them to cut an avocado and the pointer fingers have a greenish stain on them. I wish they came with more in depth cleaning directions.
customer_reviews.author: Emily B

customer_reviews.title: These are great....
customer_reviews.text: I grated some zucchini and the gloves worked great. I always cut myself when using the grater and these gloves saved my hands. I also just bought a new knife and it's extremely sharp and I have nicked myself a few times. I will for sure be using these gloves when I use this knife. They are easy to clean....I just left them on and lathered them up with some dish soap, rinsed them out, squeezed the excess water out with a towel and hung them up to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Gadgetgal

customer_reviews.title: Does the intended job.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty careful and confident using a kitchen knife but wanted some extra left hand protection for some higher risk meat trimming tasks like trimming a brisket or trimming and cubing a chuck roast for stew. Sometime you have to get very close to the fingers when trimming. Glove material grips slippery meat nicely but other things not so well like picking up a plate. The gloves are difficult to effectively wash clean and very slow to dry. I'm thinking about throwing them into the washer on a light duty cycle, then using the dryer on low heat to dry them.
customer_reviews.author: bary

customer_reviews.title: Shredding on first use
customer_reviews.text: I grate a lot of ginger, so I was looking for something to help protect my knuckles. The very first time I used these gloves, I felt a snag on the last 2 fingers, so I re-positioned, but there was already thread in my cup from a snag on the middle finger that I didn't even feel. I hope they'll make better gardening gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jenceco

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as I expected
customer_reviews.text: After cutting the tip off my finger with a ceramic blades mandoline, I knew I needed protection. Based on the reviews I picked up these gloves and they worked fine twice. On the third time I noticed the tip of the index finger had frayed and a hole formed. Perhaps I was a bit too trusting and not paying as much attention as I should have but this really scared me. Fortunately my index finger is shorter than my middle and ring (which fit right to the end of the glove) so no damage to me this time!
customer_reviews.author: Darsonist

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I wore them today at work and LOVE THEM! I work in the Fresh Made department at a supermarket and not only do I maintain dexterity with these gloves (as opposed to the store-provided ones), but they also help keep my hands warm. The room we work in is a constant 40 degrees and your hands get cold fast working with freshly washed fruits and vegetables. I'm very happy with my purchase! Thank you for the washing tips. We wear disposable gloves over these, but they still get soiled at times.
customer_reviews.author: Suzie Cupp

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I use for cutting up all boxes we get from online shopping...... anyway the increase in volume of boxes is such that cutting boxes takes time and a lot of cuts....I had a few close calls and decided gloves were a smart move.......gloves are extremely comfortable, fit great, no sweat build up....... and if I make a mistake I'm not paying for it for two to three weeks healing from razor knife accident..... I ordered largest size, fit perfect...,.
customer_reviews.author: rs-first

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I am a girl that looks at all the good reviews! Bad reviews Good reviews. I chose this product and I've been so happy. I didn't want to buy a chain link glove because they are pricey. I don't like that I have to wear a glove over it to protect it but it does help the fingers to fit better since my hands are so small. I have had these for a few years. I wash them with dawn soap and let them air dry. Never have had a cut!
customer_reviews.author: annanicole33

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. Processed several deer with them and no cut fingers. Could have used these last year when I almost cut off two fingers. They also help with gripping things that other side would be difficult with bare hands. Easy to rinse clean, but they do tighten up when they dry.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: If you sharpen a scythe, you might like this
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy it for food service. Bought it for when I'm sharpening my scythe. I cut myself deep one day barely touching the blade. Blade obviously was sharp enough. I tried a glove carefully :-) on the blade. No cut, so I'm satisfied, heheh. And they're actually comfortable to wear. They would make good gardening gloves. So you won't get cuts pulling grass, weeds, etc.
customer_reviews.author: sj55

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I always christen all my knives with my own blood, it never fails. I have fragile skin & don't even feel it cut, just suddenly see blood, so these are going to be a welcome addition to my kitchen & for chores I need to use a knife with. The place I bought them from was fantastic, I mentioned I would need a size S & gave the M to my daughter. They immediately mailed me a size S!! Fantastic service!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila A. Foss

customer_reviews.title: Enabled me to handle my Parrot and for that-  2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves because I wanted to see if I could handle my parrot (conure) with them. (She bites and is difficult to take out of her cage when she needs to go to the vet.) I thought these might protect my fingers a bit better than an ordinary glove. She was still able to bite and hold one, but the gloves helped because she was unable to break skin. I could have used these in a size small. The medium is a bit baggy, but still able to grip well in them and they did the job.
customer_reviews.author: KittyTails

customer_reviews.title: A must for safety in the kitchen if you value your fingers
customer_reviews.text: Don’t even think about using a mandolin unless you wear these. If you Value Keeping five fingers these are a must to wear. I’ve gotten lazy thinking oh I’ll just do one or two slides across the mandolin and regretted it. I have the scars on my knuckles to prove it. There these are in excellent buy And a must for safety in the kitchen
customer_reviews.author: vafedor

customer_reviews.title: Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves to use with my mandolin, but I am using them for other slicing needs. Very well made and I feel protected when using a sharp knife. When I am slicing messy beets I use a light plastic glove over these gloves. A must have for every kitchen. I am also very impressed with the company customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Tank

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly cut-proof
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I did with these was to shove the handle of a wooden spoon in one of the fingers and then run a sharp knife across it. I didn't bear down very hard, but the knife cut all the way through the fabric. It didn't leave a mark on the wood so there is that. I don't really trust these gloves now, which basically makes them useless.
customer_reviews.author: John R Allen

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I was doing a lot of cutting with a roller blade, sometimes I'd work when tired. I didn't want to end up with a accident, a friend told me about the glove, so I got it. I won't cut without it now. I use it for cutting several layers of fabric when sewing. And in the garden I use it to separate tubers, rhizomes and roots.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra D.

customer_reviews.title: Saved my fingers a few times
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for use with a mandolin and I'm really glad I did. I really don't want to be one of those people with missing finger tips and this has saved me on more than one occasion. It does inspire a bit more confidence when slicing on a mandolin and I think that also helps as long as one doesn't take it too far.
customer_reviews.author: P3NGU1N

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: They work very well and have had no problems so far. When I ordered them I was worried about the size. My hands are rather small and sometimes a small size in gloves can be too large . I ordered the small size and they fit perfectly. Perfect fit is important for working with something sharp.
customer_reviews.author: gladfox

customer_reviews.title: I cannot say enough good things about these gloves
customer_reviews.text: Life saver. I cannot say enough good things about these gloves. I used them to install metal roof on our cabin and it lasted throughout the job and more. It also saved my hands from various cuts that would have required stitches and hospitalization because the saw jumped and hit my hand. These gloves saved me. I really recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: SecurityCamera Expert

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these after chopping the tip of my finger off cutting vegetables. They do the trick! I hand wash them with a little bit of dish soap after use and air dry. No odors doing that. Slight fraying at fingertips but no openings in the seam yet. Worth the money to not have to go through what I went through again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Anyone who cuts through these gloves it's on purpose!!!  Normal cutting action does not cause cuts!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work great. The only way you can cut yourself through these is to intentionally cut as hard as you can into them. I've used them multiple times doing the exact same cutting I had done before I purchased them. That cutting action sliced the heck out my fingers. These gloves protect them every time. It's nice to find a product that works so well!!!
customer_reviews.author: CharlieCat

customer_reviews.title: Saved my fingers, many times!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very comfortable, washable, and have protected me from my own ineptitude more times than I can remember! Before the gloves, I cut not only into my nail, but deep down into my nailbed (yeah, OWWW!) When using a ceramic knife, even the slightest slip can result in some significant injury. These gloves are awesome; flexible, comfortable, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Resonance8800

customer_reviews.title: Juice /water seeps in .
customer_reviews.text: Used this product for washing frozen chicken breasts under the warm water tap .Grip was good . Gloves fitted well. Warm water usage was comfortable.BUT WAS TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED WITH WET FINGERS. Doesn't serve my purpose . Will wait for the product to meet my requirements before buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: singh

customer_reviews.title: Slippery grip!
customer_reviews.text: Good fit and seem to be as cut resistant as advertised, but very slippery grip holding knives! I returned only because it seemed like it was just as hazardous to wear them and lose control of the knife. I’d recommend a pair with silicone grips on the palm and fingers
customer_reviews.author: RJV5057

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Toy - Indestructible
customer_reviews.text: What I really liked was, with the extra glove, was its durability and indestructibility with my AKC Rat Terrier puppy - Skipper. Please consider making a dog toy with the glove material. I stuck a squeaker inside the glove material, Skipper hasn’t been able to destroy this (glove) toy.
customer_reviews.author: Brozme

customer_reviews.title: 2 holes on FIRST use and threads unweaving in other areas!
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful that this item would provide a safety measure when cutting meat and vegetables, but there is a hole in the tip of the thumb and index finger, along with threads unweaving in other areas after just ONE use. Really disappointed, and because it was a Christmas gift, I'm unable to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE KITCHEN GLOVES
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for my mom who makes potato pancakes frequently. You have to grate the potatoes by hand and she would always get a cut from the grater. She was surprised after using them....so much easier and no cuts. You can work faster too. I tried them and love them too.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary8

customer_reviews.title: Form fitting and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, snug fitting glove for heavy wood carving with gouges, knives and ax. XL glove purchased. Update to my first review. These gloves have been so helpful in preventing cuts, jabs and scrapes associated with carving wood and other tool use activity where a grip and protection are necessary. The snug but flexible fit still allows for an amazing touch of fingers and hands to tools and materials.
customer_reviews.author: JS.

customer_reviews.title: Very good cut resistant gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are soft and stretchy. It comes in a variety of sizes. The gloves are cut resistant and 5x stronger than leather. It's a level 5 cut protection. To test it out, I tried cutting it with different types of knives and it didn't even leave a scratch or tear. It didn't cut my hands when I wore the gloves and tried cutting it too. Amazing! I would recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Saves me from loosing a finger!
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this glove. I only received one. Hum, I really didn't know I bought a pair. I have only the left-hand glove. However, so far no accidents. Feel more at ease when using my really good knives that can cut you very badly without even feeling it. I am just a little sad about my purchase as I didn't notice it says the Stark Safe Cut glove is only Cut Resistant not cut proof. My knives are so sharp I feel like even while wearing this glove I might have an accident. Next time I will read the description of the product better.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Radcliffe

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are essential for using a mandolin and perfect for a hand grater if you value your fingers
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are essential for using a mandolin and perfect for a hand grater if you value your fingers! Having said that, my three-star rating is because they are not a small size. For reference, I wear size small winter gloves, rubber gloves, bike gloves and these are quite a bit larger. I have previously bought a pair on Amazon that did fit, I shall keep looking and this pair will be a gift for someone else as they are a great product. If you are a "small" these are not for you, but they are well-made and a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Janj

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended. Stark Safe has my vote.
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I ordered these, I received an e-mail from Stark Safe. Very helpful representative, and some safety instructions. It's nice to see a company following up on their products and making sure you are happy with your purchase. As for the gloves themselves, they are awesome. Very well-made, breathable, durable, and efficient. If a Mora can't cut them, I'm pretty confident wearing them. Note that they are not stab-resistant. Make sure to order the right size. Highly recommended. Stark Safe has my vote.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Lask

customer_reviews.title: Safe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for spoon carving and I have not cut myself even a little bit thus far. I have tiny hands (I usually try to find XS/Child) and while these are slightly big on me, they are not so big I can't have a firm grip on the sometimes narrow stems of a spoon. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: teresa

customer_reviews.title: ZERO CUT PROTECTION
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these for cut protection. A very light draw of a knife blade across these gloves completely cuts through the fabric. I found the sizing as expected. I'm a 6'1" guy, 210lbs. I like gloves to be snug and the medium was 'fit like a glove' perfect. These are also comfortable. Again, do not buy these for cut protection. I'd be surprised if someone hasn't already been seriously cut thinking these are legitimately offering cut protection. The packaging states level 5 cut protection, but that is a false marketing ploy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: If you snag these at all...
customer_reviews.text: If you get a snag in these at all it ruins the cut protection on them. I will not be getting another pair, I got them to help protect my hands from my rats and rabbits claws and while they worked briefly the minute they get any kind of snag they begin to immediately fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: The GreyOne

customer_reviews.title: Mandolin sliced through it
customer_reviews.text: I have had these gloves for a little over a month and only used a handful of times. I use them with a not too sharp mandolin and to my surprise a big hunk is missing from the finger. Luckily it didn’t cut my finger. Maybe I got a bum pair but doesn’t seem to keep me that safe.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a finger savior.
customer_reviews.text: I always cut a good slice into the tip of my thumb or finger whenever I'm slicing apples for strudels or pies. (Screaming children and slicing apples isnt a good mix) This has stopped that entirely!! Just wash your hand with it on using some dish soap when you're done and hang dry to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg G.

customer_reviews.title: Great for stained glass
customer_reviews.text: I use these on my grinder for stained glass. They work great, are comfortable and actually fit! I got a small but I also have small hands and most gloves are too big. I only gave 4 stars for durability because they’ve recently developed holes in the tips of the thumbs where I press on the glass most. But at $8 for nearly a year of use I can’t complain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cutting faster with safety gloves
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of safety gloves and I used them with my mandoline. This gave me the confidence to slice faster. Since I've never used kitchen safety gloves before, I don't really have anything to compare it with but the fit is nice and it seems to work.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: These gloves were...
customer_reviews.text: These Stark Safe Cut Resistant gloves proved to be a great option for work and they also provided excellent protection throughout the duration of the volunteer work we had purchased them for... Can't believe that they are such a great price too!!! It seems that they work just as well as more expensive brands
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: A must have in your kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Love them . No more nicks or cuts . Also it’s a better grub on the food while you’re working with it .
customer_reviews.author: Jessie S Leichner

customer_reviews.title: Better than chainmail kitchen gloves by far!
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT!!! Bought them for my fiance whom was always cutting herself when chopping vegetables. They won't keep you from getting poked by the tip of a knife but with my sharpest knife (you can literally cut potatoes with just the weight of the knife) I could not slice through this glove and couldn't even feel the edge through the glove! They dirty? Just throw them in the washer! I highly recommend these!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kody

customer_reviews.title: Should work fine
customer_reviews.text: Have not used them yet. But they will be handy in preventing cuts when I’m doing a lot of slicing.
customer_reviews.author: Na Spa

customer_reviews.title: No blood!
customer_reviews.text: It never fails that I cut myself at least once when chopping vegetables. I bought these on the recommendation of folks that use mandolin cutter. They are great. Fit snuggly enough that I can still pick up things with my fingers, rinse to clean and I have not cut myself once!
customer_reviews.author: Chincoteague

customer_reviews.title: My hands are safer
customer_reviews.text: The small is not glove-tight, but it good enough to keep my protected. They stain from vegetables, but that's not an issue for me, my hands are protected. Aging is hard enough without having to get hurt just fixing food. These are highly recommended by me.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WAIT
customer_reviews.text: I waited until after and ACCIDENT to purchase this!! This glove is really a FINGER SAVER, and really peace of confidence when preparing foods, using a mandolin, grater, slicer etc. After use, I just toss it in the dishwasher and hang to dry. MUST BUY NOW...don't wait...great gift too
customer_reviews.author: Mama Approved

customer_reviews.title: Best Seller on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Jessie at Youphoria really made a great impression on me. I hurriedly bought a pair of these cut proof gloves, and did not check the size. I bought a medium by accident. She reached out to me to see how I liked my purchase. I really liked the gloves, but I got the wrong size, I told her. She said that she would send me the size I needed, because she wanted me to be comfortable wearing the gloves I got from her. Now that is outstanding customer service. I one hundred percent recommend her as a seller. Top Notch. Thanks so much. Ready to buy again, looks like she has great products.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works.. no cuts
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the extra large because most large size gloves are too small. These are a little large as the fingers on the glove go over my finger tips, but at least I don't have to stretch them to put them on. They work great for not getting cuts on my fingers when I cut veggies.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stonehouse

customer_reviews.title: Works as they should.
customer_reviews.text: They fit and work as they should. My son is an accident waiting to happen, especially when using sharp objects. Unless he just point blanks stabs himself, these gloves have protected him through cleaning about 150 fish so far with no issues of injury to him! I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Melvin

customer_reviews.title: They seem to work.
customer_reviews.text: I tested these with a couple of very sharp knives, and the gloves barely even showed signs of damage, let alone being cut through. I have not tried them with a sharp serrated edge (I don't have a filet knife handy and my steak knives are getting dull), but them seem pretty good overall. They ARE a bit on the small side, I ordered XL and they were tight, about as tight as a large size work glove on my hands (my hands are right on the border between large and extra large size).
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to "bite gloves."
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in place of "bite gloves." My intention was to wear them while I play with my dog. She likes playing with my hands and fake biting them. I have used the gloves a few times, and they work perfect for me. My only complaint is the smell or taste to my dog..but I suppose that can be remedied by washing them in soapy water.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: After slicing my finger a month ago and getting stitches these are wonderful! Comfortable, easy to use and wear. You feel more confident when using any sharp tool. I have small hands and ordered a medium and they fit great!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Already had a small hole in it.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a small hole already in it. Looks like it may have been sliced before so It didnt leave me with very much confidence that the gloves would be cut resistant...
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I recently saw a pair of level-5 cut resistant gloves in my local big box retailer for $13.50. I almost bought them, but figured I'd check Amazon first. Bingo! I found these for 40% Less! I wear these when using my Mandoline slicer, or when manually slicing produce. They also do double duty when removing hot items from the microwave. They may not have the insulating capacity of oven mitts, but work fine for things that are moderately hot. As some other reviewers have noted, the sizes run small: I normally wear a "Large" Glove, but ordered "Extra Large" And they fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Atom Boy

customer_reviews.title: Safe to use with a mandoline
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with my mandoline after cutting my thumb. They are great. Comfortable fit; softer than I expected but durable. I am still very careful because mandoline blades are extremely sharp but I feel so much safer using them.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: ... of these gloves because both my wife and I love to cook
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 pair of these gloves because both my wife and I love to cook, which involves a lot of cutting and prepping. We have yet to use them for their intended purpose, but they should protect both of us from nicks and cuts, especially when using and cleaning our electric food slicer. I tried on one glove and found the medium size was perfect for me. These gloves fit snugly, almost like rubber gloves. To me, that should help with "touch and feel" of the items being cut or handled. I intend to buy some to give as gifts for friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: K. Faaborg

customer_reviews.title: It is really safe cut.
customer_reviews.text: This gloves are really made cut free , I used the huge knife to cut watermelon, while going through 7 times on this gloves on cut plate ( not on my hand) they are just as they were shipped ,I am impressed and purchased few more sets of different size. I definitely recommend to any one who is responsible for cooking, cutting and in restaurant business .
customer_reviews.author: V-Man

customer_reviews.title: Pumpkin Carving Made Safer!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my fair share of nicks and cuts in the kitchen and quite frankly, I'm tired of them. I enjoy using good quality, properly sharpened knives but if they so much as touch my skin, I'm bleeding. Ugh. Thank goodness for cut resistant gloves! I had been shopping for a pair when I was able to purchase these at a slight discount to test and review. They work! They stop those accidental slips and glances that previously have resulted in teeny but blood-gushing cuts from reaching your skin. Now I can filet fish and carve pumpkins without worry that any of my ten fingers will go missing!
customer_reviews.author: Outdoorsy Boy's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Saved my fingers
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this with my new (very sharp) mandolin slicer. I am sure it has saved my fingers from numerous cuts already. Does a great job protecting me. I wish these gloves would dry faster but I am not complaining.
customer_reviews.author: M. M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for a cat
customer_reviews.text: I used these to give my cat a bath but she still scratched me a little. I will upload pictures of the cat scratches on my groin later when I get a chance for my mom to take a photo. Her phone has a better camera.
customer_reviews.author: JHW

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these gloves and there was a defect so I ordered a replacement and it was no better. The first time the stitching was bad at the base of the finger on one of the gloves making it fit improperly. I ordered a replacement and the replacement had a hole in it! The hole was about the size of a dime on one of the fingers. I will not order again.
customer_reviews.author: Tarheel Blue

customer_reviews.title: First impression is great
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these once, but they seem to work well. I purchased these because I gave myself a nasty cut on a mandolin slicer and decided that I should have a bit more protection. I have small hands and the fingers could be a little shorter for me, but they are not so long that they are awkward to use. The fabric is stretchy enough that I think it would fit a range of sizes. Customer service is excellent. I received an email with care and use information. If they do not last well, I may update this review. But I gave 5 starts based on the excellent customer service and the fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kay H

customer_reviews.title: Could be a life saver
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves. No more sliced and diced fingers (if you remember to put them on before you start) I bought for my mom who is on blood thinners and a little nic could be life threatening. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: John in Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Glad I had the glove on but it isn’t any good after wearing the first time.
customer_reviews.text: Wore one glove to use with my mandolin and evidently got too close to the blade and have a hole in the end of the finger on the glove. Glad I had the glove on but it isn’t any good after wearing the first time.
customer_reviews.author: betfrs

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for cutting fish. I've cut myself in the past and thought this would help prevent anymore accidents. Arrived in time. Good packaging. Appears well made. Medium for my hands perfectly. I didn't try to cut myself to see if it works. I'll believe the reviews instead. 5 🌟
customer_reviews.author: ridere46

customer_reviews.title: These gloves work!  No cuts!
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of cut resistant gloves until a friend suggested I buy them because my dog has some health issues and has started biting me when I put on her harness. She is small but her teeth are sharp! This gloves work wonderfully. Since I started wearing them, no bites. If your hands need protecting, these gloves will keep your hands safe.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought these years ago
customer_reviews.text: I actually measured my hand with a ruler and following the sizing guideline and they fit perfect. I am a tall woman and the size Small fit perfectly. They save my knuckles while grating cheese. Haven't tried to clean them yet but plan to hand wash and air dry soon. Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves them!
customer_reviews.text: My wife recently cut her finger while cooking and these gloves have allowed her to chop with ease. Has great grip and doesn't feel clunky. Also fits exactly as written. Will be getting more in the future!
customer_reviews.author: D.A

customer_reviews.title: Safely cut veggies and meats without cuts...
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I've purchased and worn these gloves, I've stopped getting nicks on my fingers. For years, I've cut myself on multiple fingers and I wasn't aware that these gloves were available. I found out about them while reading a gourmet cook book a few weeks ago. The Stark Safe Cut Resistant gloves run true to size. I have rather large hands and ordered the large gloves which fit perfectly. I've already shared the news with family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Ebelleboo2

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: I must have these when I use my mandolin slicer. They have saved me more than once. Lightweight, fit is perfect, they do the job and keep my hands safe. Us them all the time and will certainly buy another pair when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Kmom

customer_reviews.title: Definitely cut resistant and great fit.
customer_reviews.text: Cut resistant as described (by accident and on purpose trials). I don't use these gloves for kitchen food prep but rather hobby stuff involving exacto knife/blade and lexan scissors and they have been impervious to sharp objects sliding across them, so mission accomplished.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: No More Cuts
customer_reviews.text: In our house we joke about making sure that when working with a kitchen knife you debone the chicken and not your hand. These glove make debone hands or cuts a distant memory. The texture fabric makes gripping the knife and cutting material safe and secure. I actual tried to cut myself and fail miserable. I wouldn't suggest trying that but from my point of view that was the acid test. The glove clean up nicely and maintain their shape and safety rating. Every kitchen should have a pair. This product was provide at a free or reduced rate by the supplier, but this did not impact my opinion or review of this product.
customer_reviews.author: John O. Keeler

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: They help for small force puncture type accidents. Had to replace my set of gloves because a puncture type stab damaged the glove, but protected my hand. I was lucky. The sacrafice was worth the save.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up at all
customer_reviews.text: Used these gloves once with a mandoline slicer. Sliced a hole in the tip nearly immediately. Only giving 2 stars because it provided just enough resistance/padding that I thankfully didn't slice my fingertips off. Will not be buying again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Erica N.

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my young grandson and his dad to clean their catch(es). Makes me feel better as they handle extremely sharp knives. I gave 4 stars only because I have not used them personally so cannot attest to all features but I'm sure they do the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle N.

customer_reviews.title: Stark Safe Cut Resistant Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit perfectly, are comfortable and make me feel very safe while using my mandoline slicer. I am very happy with these gloves! The price and fast shipping were great, too. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Miller

customer_reviews.title: Gloves protect from sharp corners and objects.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves because I was working on my dryer. The material that the dryer is made out of had sharp corners and edges that left small cuts and scraps all over my hands. These gloves fit nice and snug, making them easy to work in and also shielded my hands from the sharp edges.
customer_reviews.author: AJ814

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! We love them!
customer_reviews.text: We cannot say enough good about this product! It works very well and us comfortable too! It fits tight like formed to your hand more, which helps when you are trying to grab something. We use these gloves to cut up meat and they are amazing. I don't know how many cuts we have saved our hands. They may seem kind of cheap only based on the price, but they are great!!! You can wash them in your washer as well with air drying!
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Protection from cuts during household use
customer_reviews.text: I liked the way it fits and it stays true to the product description. Also, these gloves are easy to clean, provide good grip. For household use of chopping vegetables, or cutting poultry/fish, it definitely provides protection from cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Kaushik

customer_reviews.title: Don't cut yourself !  buy this
customer_reviews.text: After my spouse required stitches from a grater - I bought this and it works wonderfully well. Save yourself a trip to the doctor for stitches and buy it ! Well worth the money and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure what to expect with these cut resistant gloves, but they stood up to metal deconstruction. They did catch a couple of times but they didn't rip or tear and protected my hands
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: I use this when using my mandolin slicer. I was always cutting myself on the last few slices on items that don't fit in the holder, which is most of the things I slice. Saved me from many a cut.
customer_reviews.author: April444

customer_reviews.title: Works Well with All Application to Protect your hands!
customer_reviews.text: I gave my older pair away to friend that cuts duct board with very sharp knives for saftey. I bought a pair for my mom in her 80s who likes to put weeds in the yard to protect her hand. They work wonderfully for all application when your trying to keep your hands protected. I think every kitchen needs them.
customer_reviews.author: In My Opinon, Mr.Xray2.0

customer_reviews.title: No more sliced fingers!
customer_reviews.text: After I had cut two fingertips in 8 weeks, a chef friend said to get these gloves. The medium size fits nice and snug. Only one glove needed at a time. Wearing a glove (on the non-knife hand) to cut carrots or whatever takes some getting used to, to make it a habit. No more trips to the emergency room for me. I'm thinking it should wash up easily with the week's laundry.
customer_reviews.author: Robert WC

customer_reviews.title: Holy cow these are small.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, these are small. Buy several sizes larger than you think. I have relatively small hands and I can't fit my hands all the way in them. My glove size is 9 if anyone knows their glove size. My wife's hands are really small (she wears about a size 4 ring and can't buy a lot of rings because they can't size them that small) and they are even a little small on her. They are snug on her, but you need these to have a little give so you don't cut through them. She could use the next bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Rod

customer_reviews.title: avoid that holiday trip to the ER buy these gloves for knife use
customer_reviews.text: These gloves have the feel of a standard cloth glove but with cut resistant fibers woven into them they are very cut resistant. Put the glove on the hand not holding the knife. These are not unlike items used in meat processing plant. Good for your church kitchen. An easy way to avoid band aides and pain and maybe a few stitches.
customer_reviews.author: Variably Illuminated

customer_reviews.title: Traditional garden gloves - watch out
customer_reviews.text: Most garden gloves wear our especially the finger tips. I wanted a better glove and this one works. Great fit, sturdy, stronger than leather. One glove pair is not enough..
customer_reviews.author: Shamrock

product_meta.title: Stark Safe Cut Resistant Gloves (1 Pair) Food Grade Level 5 Protection, Safety Cutting Gloves for Kitchen, Mandolin Slicing, Fish Fillet, Oyster Shucking, Meat Cutting and Wood Carving - Medium
feature_bullets: QUALITY WHERE IT COUNTS: Stark Safe cut resistant gloves are made with the highest level of cut resistant material available on the market - 4 times stronger than leather - Level 5 cut resistance protection (EN388).

MULTI-FUNCTIONAL: Great for food prep, cutting, slicing, peeling, grating, mandoline use, wood carving, oyster shucking, carpentry, metal work and more. Bulk Prices available for butchers, restaurants, and businesses.

COMFORT FIT: Superior grip with a snug fit for small and large hands - prepare food or work on jobs with ultimate dexterity and precision. These cut gloves provide the feeling you need to get the job done.

NO MORE HAND SWEAT: This premium anti cut material also allows maximum breathability for those long processes so your hands stay dry and comfortable. Put in a long day’s work on the kitchen line or food prep for thanksgiving dinner with complete comfort.

CUSTOMER CARE: We want to keep your hands safe and comfortable. If you aren’t satisfied with the comfort and application of your cut resistant gloves, we’ll make sure you’re taken care of. No hassle. Cause we know you have things to do.

specifications.Warranty Description: Manufacturer warranty for 60 days from date of purchase.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,996 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
